key_points: Helima Croft warns of the growing threat of cyberattacks in the wake of the Colonial Pipeline hack.
Colonial Pipeline, crucial for East Coast fuel supply, was shut down due to a hack by the group DarkSide.
Croft, a member of the National Petroleum Council and Global Head at RBC Capital Markets, discusses the impact on energy and national security.
The incident has led to significant fuel shortages and panic buying across the United States.
Gas prices have spiked to a nearly seven-year high, with about 1,800 stations out of fuel.
The rise in cyberattacks targets critical infrastructure, with many entities vulnerable.
Private ownership of critical infrastructure complicates disclosure and response to cyberattacks.
The U.S. government is seeking better information sharing and improved cyber defenses with private sector.
Ransomware attacks cost American companies $20 billion in the last year.
Previous major cyberattack mentioned: 2020 attack on SolarWinds by hackers linked to Russian intelligence.
spokespersons: Helima Croft (Member, National Petroleum Council; Global Head of Commodity Strategy, RBC Capital Markets)
